isis.stitle: 13 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14613 - REMOVE - AUXILIARY SECTION

step1.para: Place the transmission in the vertical position. Put blocks under the clutch housing to prevent damage to the input shaft. Removal can also be completed in the horizontal position.
Remove the four bolts and the auxiliary countershaft rear bearing cover, gasket, and rear bearing shim ( Figure 28).

figure.caption: Figure 28. Remove Auxiliary Countershaft Rear Bearing Cover, Gasket, and Rear Bearing Shim

note.para: Auxiliary countershaft retaining straps may be installed to hold countershafts in place ( Figure 29). Auxiliary can be removed without straps; use caution.

figure.caption: Figure 29. Auxiliary Countershaft Retaining Straps May Be Installed to Hold Countershafts in Place

step1.para: Install an auxiliary countershaft retaining strap with three 3/8 inch x 1 inch clean bolts. Place a flat washer under the strap to prevent damage to the rear auxiliary countershaft bearing.

caution.para: Do not use an air gun. Tighten by hand until the bolts are snug.

step1.para: Repeat Steps 2 and 3 for the remaining auxiliary countershaft.
Remove the 19 bolts that hold the auxiliary section to the transmission case ( Figure 30).

figure.caption: Figure 30. Remove Bolts Holding Auxiliary Section to Transmission Case

note.para: There are three lengths of bolts; note their location.

step1.para: Insert three bolts in the tapped holes of the housing flange ( Figure 31). Tighten evenly to move auxiliary section to the rear and just far enough from the front section to break the gasket seal.

figure.caption: Figure 31. Insert Bolts in Housing Flange

step1.para: Remove the bolts and attach a chain hoist to the auxiliary section. Move the assembly to the rear until free of the front section and remove the gasket ( Figure 32).

The auxiliary section can also be removed with the transmission set in the vertical position ( Figure 33). Block under the clutch housing to prevent damage to the input shaft. Remove the retaining bolts from the housing flange. Lift the assembly from the front section. Remove the gasket.

figure.caption: Figure 33. Auxiliary Section Can Be Removed With Transmission Set in Vertical Position
